hero.headline: Your AI Agents, Orchestrated.
hero.subheadline: Run multiple Claude Code instances on the same project with shared context, file locking, and real-time control — from any device.
hero.micro_copy: No credit card. Self-hosted. MIT License.
hero.social_proof: Trusted by developers building with Claude Code worldwide

pain_1.title: Three agents, one codebase, zero coordination
pain_1.desc: You launch multiple Claude instances on the same project. They edit the same files. Merge conflicts everywhere. Hours of AI work, lost.

pain_2.title: Context that vanishes between sessions
pain_2.desc: Every new Claude session starts from scratch. You paste the same instructions again and again. Your agents forget everything.

pain_3.title: Flying blind with multiple agents
pain_3.desc: Which agent is doing what? Who changed that file? Is that task already done? You have no idea until something breaks.

solution.headline: Your agents deserve a home.
solution.subheadline: ClaudeNest gives your Claude Code instances shared understanding, conflict prevention, and a unified command center.
solution.pillar_1: pgvector RAG means your agents build on each other's knowledge — not start from scratch.
solution.pillar_2: File locking + atomic task claiming = zero merge conflicts, zero duplicated work.
solution.pillar_3: See every agent, every task, every keystroke — from your browser or your phone.

features.subheadline: From a single dashboard to a full multi-agent command center.

remote.title: Control from anywhere
remote.desc: Access your Claude Code instances from any browser, any device. WebSocket relay means every keystroke arrives in real-time, with <50ms latency.

multi_agent.title: Agents that collaborate
multi_agent.desc: Run 5+ Claude instances on the same project. Atomic task claiming prevents duplicated work. Each agent knows what the others are doing.

context.title: Shared intelligence
context.desc: 384-dimensional vector embeddings via pgvector give your agents semantic understanding of the entire project. They search by meaning, not keywords.

realtime.title: Every keystroke, live
realtime.desc: Laravel Reverb WebSocket channels relay terminal output in real-time. Watch your agents work from anywhere — even your phone.

locking.title: Zero merge conflicts
locking.desc: Automatic file locking with expiration, force-release, and bulk operations. Two agents can never edit the same file simultaneously.

mcp.title: Infinite extensibility
mcp.desc: Model Context Protocol support means your agents can use any MCP tool. Discovery is automatic, execution is seamless.

how_it_works.subheadline: From installation to full multi-agent orchestration in minutes, not hours.

step_2.title: Start a Session
step_2.desc: Launch Claude Code remotely from any device

step_3.desc: Coordinate multiple agents with shared context

comparison.subheadline: The most complete orchestration platform built specifically for Claude Code.

t1.quote: ClaudeNest completely changed how I work. I can finally run multiple agents without them stepping on each other's toes.
t1.author: Sarah J.

t2.quote: The context sharing is a game changer. My agents actually know what happened in previous sessions.

t3.quote: Being able to check on my agents from my phone while away from my desk is incredible.

pricing.headline: Free forever. Premium when you scale.
pricing.subheadline: ClaudeNest is open source and self-hosted. No usage fees, no per-seat pricing, no surprises.

q1.a: Yes. ClaudeNest is MIT-licensed and self-hosted. The Community tier is free forever. Pro and Enterprise tiers are for managed hosting and priority support.

q2.q: Does it work with any LLM or just Claude?
q2.a: ClaudeNest is purpose-built for Claude Code by Anthropic. This specialization lets us optimize every interaction, from PTY management to context injection. We don't dilute focus by supporting every model.

q3.q: How does the RAG context system work?
q3.a: When an agent learns something, we generate a 384-dimensional vector embedding using BGE-small-en and store it in PostgreSQL with pgvector. Other agents search by semantic similarity — meaning, not keywords. The result: agents build on each other's understanding.

q4.q: Can multiple agents really work on the same files?
q4.a: Not at the same time — that's the point. Our file locking system prevents two agents from editing the same file simultaneously. Locks have expiration, force-release, and bulk operations. Zero merge conflicts.

q5.a: A Linux server with PHP 8.3+, PostgreSQL 16 (with pgvector), Redis, and Node.js 20. A standard $20/month VPS handles most setups. Docker Compose makes installation one command.

q6.q: Is my code sent to your servers?
q6.a: Never. ClaudeNest is self-hosted. Your code, your agents, your infrastructure. We never see your source code or your prompts.

q7.q: How does it compare to Claude-Flow?
q7.a: Claude-Flow focuses on swarm intelligence with 60+ agents but has no web dashboard and no mobile app. ClaudeNest provides a complete platform: web dashboard, mobile app, pgvector RAG, and file locking — all purpose-built for Claude Code.

q8.a: Absolutely. ClaudeNest is open source and MIT licensed. Check our CONTRIBUTING.md for setup instructions, code standards, and our ADR process.

opensource.headline: Built in the open
opensource.desc: Inspect every line, contribute features, and self-host on your own infrastructure. No vendor lock-in, ever.

final_cta.subheadline: Deploy ClaudeNest in minutes. Control Claude Code from anywhere. Coordinate teams of AI agents on a single project.

footer.desc: Remote orchestration platform for Claude Code.
